title: How to Connect AirPods to a Lenovo Laptop: Easy Pair Guide

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. If you're using Windows 11 on your Lenovo laptop, use this method to pair your AirPods. To open Settings, right-click the Windows icon in the taskbar and click Settings . You can also press Win + I on your keyboard, or click the gear icon in the Windows menu. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Bluetooth & devices.
steps.content: Click Bluetooth & devices . You'll see this on the left side of the window.

steps.title: Click the switch next to "Bluetooth" to toggle it on .
steps.content: Click the switch next to "Bluetooth" to toggle it on . If the toggle is pointing to the right, it's on. Skip this step if Bluetooth is already on.

steps.title: Click the Add device tile.
steps.content: Click the Add device tile. This will allow you to add anything that's within range and in pairing mode. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Put your AirPods in pairing mode.
steps.content: Put your AirPods in pairing mode. With your AirPods or AirPods Pro inside the case , open the lid and press and hold the button on the back or inside the case. Release the button when it flashes white.

steps.title: Select Bluetooth on your computer.
steps.content: Select Bluetooth on your computer. You're prompting your laptop to look for Bluetooth signals. Your AirPods and anything else that's sending a Bluetooth signal will appear as connectable devices.

steps.title: Click your AirPods in the list.
steps.content: Click your AirPods in the list. They will appear next to an icon of headphones.

steps.title: Click Done.
steps.content: Click Done . Once you click your AirPods, your laptop will try to connect with them. After the pairing is successful, you can click Done and close the window.

steps.title: Select your AirPods for audio output.
steps.content: Select your AirPods for audio output. Click the arrow next to the volume control icon in your taskbar, and select Headphones (AirPods) . Disconnect your AirPods by either turning off Bluetooth on your laptop or by pressing the button on your AirPods case.

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. If you're pairing AirPods to Windows 10, start by pressing Win + I on your keyboard to open your Settings.

steps.title: Click Devices.
steps.content: Click Devices . This is next to an icon of a keyboard and speaker and says "Bluetooth, printers, mouse."

steps.title: Click the switch next to "Bluetooth" to toggle it on .
steps.content: Click the switch next to "Bluetooth" to toggle it on . If the toggle is pointing to the right, it's on. Skip this step if Bluetooth is already on.

steps.title: Click + Add Bluetooth or other device.
steps.content: Click + Add Bluetooth or other device . It's at the top of the menu and will prompt your computer to look for something.

steps.title: Put your AirPods in pairing mode.
steps.content: Put your AirPods in pairing mode. With your AirPods inside the case, open the lid and press and hold the button on the back or inside the case. Release the button when it flashes white.

steps.title: Click your AirPods in the list.
steps.content: Click your AirPods in the list. They will appear next to an icon of headphones.

steps.title: Click Done.
steps.content: Click Done . Once you click your AirPods, your laptop will try to connect with them. After the pairing is successful, you can click Done and close the window.

steps.title: Select your AirPods for audio output.
steps.content: Select your AirPods for audio output. Click the speaker icon in your taskbar, then click the arrow icon and select Headphones (AirPods Stereo) . [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Disconnect your AirPods by either turning off Bluetooth on your laptop or by pressing the button on your AirPods case.

steps.title: Make sure you have the default audio set to your AirPods.
steps.content: Make sure you have the default audio set to your AirPods. If you're connected, but not hearing sound, you might have your audio output set to the wrong device. Fortunately, you can change your audio output easily. Click the arrow next to your speaker icon (in the taskbar) and select your AirPods. You can then adjust the volume louder or softer by moving the slider left and right.

steps.title: Restart your Lenovo laptop.
steps.content: Restart your Lenovo laptop. Many times, simply turning it off and turning it back on will fix the issue.

steps.title: Make sure your AirPods are in Pairing Mode.
steps.content: Make sure your AirPods are in Pairing Mode. With your AirPods inside the case, open the lid and press and hold the button until a light flashes white. This light can be on the outside or inside of the case. [4] X Research source It might help to restart pairing mode. To do so, take out your AirPods and close the case, then open the case, and put your AirPods back in before pressing the button on the back of the case.

steps.title: Restart Bluetooth on your laptop.
steps.content: Restart Bluetooth on your laptop. If you've already turned your laptop off and back on again, but your AirPods aren't showing up in the list, try turning your Bluetooth off and back on .

steps.title: Update your Bluetooth driver.
steps.content: Update your Bluetooth driver. An out-of-date driver might be all that's causing the issue, update it in your device manager. [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Try other Bluetooth headphones.
steps.content: Try other Bluetooth headphones. If you can connect to other Bluetooth headphones, you know that something is wrong with your AirPods or with your connection between the AirPods.

steps.title: Remove other devices.
steps.content: Remove other devices. Some other Bluetooth connections, like that with your mouse, may be negatively interfering with your connection process. You might also have a phone that also has Bluetooth on and that signal is blocking your laptop from your AirPods. The best thing to try here is to remove all Bluetooth-enabled devices away. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Update your AirPods.
steps.content: Update your AirPods. The firmware for your AirPods is often updated with a paired iPhone or iPad, so open that AirPods app and update them . [7] X Research source

steps.title: Out of range.
steps.content: Out of range. If your AirPods are far away from your laptop, you might be getting poor audio quality. To fix this, get closer (within 30-60 feet) to your Lenovo laptop.

steps.title: Charge your AirPods.
steps.content: Charge your AirPods. A drained battery can make audio sound bad. Just put your AirPods back in their (charged) case for about 20 minutes. If the case is also drained, charging your AirPods might take more than 20 minutes. [8] X Research source
